summary: This document is a collection of FAA aircraft registration records for a Bell 430 helicopter with tail number N331JE (previously N901RL). The records show the aircraft was owned by Hyperion Air LLC (and previously Hyperion Air Inc.), with registration applications, bills of sale, renewal notices, and international flight declarations. The registration expired in September 2019 and a renewal/cancellation notice was issued in November 2019.

persons.name: Lawrence Visoski
persons.role: Director of Aviation for Hyperion Air Inc.
persons.context: Signed a Declaration of International Operations for the aircraft on July 2, 2012, as the Director of Aviation for Hyperion Air Inc.

persons.name: Angie Risley
persons.role: Representative of Insured Aircraft Title Service, Inc.
persons.context: Requested the reservation of the special registration number N331JE for the aircraft on behalf of Hyperion Air Inc. in May 2012.

persons.name: William P Merriam Jnr
persons.context: Signed as a director on a bill of sale for the aircraft in March 2012, transferring an interest to Hyperion Air Inc.

connections.description: Lawrence Visoski is identified as the Director of Aviation for Hyperion Air Inc., signing official flight documents on its behalf.
Angie Risley, acting for Insured Aircraft Title Service, Inc., submitted an N-number reservation request for Hyperion Air Inc.'s aircraft.
William P Merriam Jnr signed a bill of sale as a director, likely representing the seller or a related corporate entity in a transaction with Hyperion Air Inc.

events.title: International Ferry Flight
events.description: The aircraft (N331JE) was scheduled for an international ferry flight from West Palm Beach, Florida, to St. Thomas, USVI, with stops in the Bahamas, Turks and Caicos, Dominican Republic, and Puerto Rico.

events.title: Aircraft Sale to Hyperion Air LLC
events.description: A bill of sale records the transfer of the aircraft from Hyperion Air, Inc. to Hyperion Air LLC.

events.title: Aircraft Registration Expiration
events.description: The FAA registration for the aircraft N331JE expired. A renewal notice was later sent in November 2019 indicating the registration had lapsed.

events.title: FAA Registration Renewal/Cancellation Notice
events.description: The FAA issued a notice that the aircraft's registration had expired and the N-number was pending cancellation, giving the owner 60 days to respond.

keyFacts: The Bell 430 helicopter with serial number 49078 was registered under tail numbers N901RL and later the special registration N331JE.
The aircraft was owned by corporate entities Hyperion Air Inc. and later Hyperion Air LLC.
The aircraft was used for international travel, including a detailed ferry flight plan from Florida to the US Virgin Islands in July 2012.
FAA records show the aircraft's registration expired on September 30, 2019, and was pending cancellation as of November 2019.
Lawrence Visoski is identified as the Director of Aviation for Hyperion Air Inc., signing a flight declaration in 2012.
